name: Royal Angkor Resort & Spa

reviews.text: Having travelled extensively through South East Asia and experienced all levels of hotel accommodation,have to say The Royal Angkor Resort Hotel is one of the best for service, friendliness and efficiency. The staff and their hotel's resident manager, Mr Juliao Leitao, were attentive and helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them. Mr Leitao tries to meet ALL guests on arrival and makes a point of meeting up over breakfast or snack/dinner or drinks during your stay to make sure everything is going smoothly. And he's there to wave goodbye when you leave! The staff are well trained and their level of English is outstanding!
reviews.title: First class in Cambodia

reviews.text: Thanks to our great travel consultant, Lenny from Expat Holidays Thailand – http://www.expatholidaysthailand.com – we were upgraded to a deluxe room with a balcony overlooking the expansive pool & garden area, and out to Angkor in the distance. The room was well equipped (toiletries, robes, slippers, tea/coffee making, mini-bar etc) and everything was clean and maintained. Restaurant meals were of high standard & well priced (both western & Cambodian options) and the two-hour "happy hour" (in the bar and by the pool) made for a lovely relaxing start to the evening after a hot and hectic day of sightseeing. We didn't have time to use the spa facilities, but reports from other guests indicate the treatments were well worth the effort. Free in-room wi-fi and access to computers in the business centre add to the high standard provided by this hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing service, good value for money

reviews.text: Overall we couldn't fault the RAR or the staff. Even after we questioned something on our check-out bill (which turned out to be correct as per hotel calculation), the reception staff were not fazed, instead they presented us with a Khmer scarf as a "thank you/farewell gift" from the hotel.
reviews.title: wonderful stay

reviews.text: There may be other hotels in Siem Reap with a higher * rating, but you won't find better service or value for money, for sure! Great work Mr Laitao and staff – a credit to RAR and to Cambodia!
reviews.title: Perfect choice for families.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I spent 4 nights here. I have to say this is one of the best hotel I ever stay. Big size room, nice atmosphere, perfect service and people. Breakfast also was good with many choices. All staffs were so helpful and friendly. Thank you for making our trip a great one. Surely recommend this hotel to our friends.
reviews.title: Excellent facilities and services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the last hotel of 5 in which we stayed on out trip to Vietnam and Cambodia. The hotel is situated 2-3 miles along the main hotel 'strip' of Siem Reap and too far out to walk into town. First impressions are of a very comfortable modern hotel with all the facilities one could want. The staff were welcoming and always very friendly and courteous and tha manager makes a point of greeting his guests which is a nice touch.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable

reviews.text: The position of the hotel is a bit of a way out but the hotel provides a free 2 hourly shuttle bus into town and I very much appreciate that they put on an additional bus when we had a large group traveling into town one evening. The ground of the hotel are beautiful with nicely laid out gardens and a clean well managed pool area. There is also a gym/massage area - with a free 10minute shoulder massage.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: The rooms were very comfortable and the bath even had a jacuzzi - not really my thing but a nice touch - some people in our party did have complaints of their room being noisy but we had no problem. One problem was that on one morning there was no hot water for about 20 mins - I think this might have been a once off as I think there was a power cut in the night and we did not have the problem again.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel

reviews.text: We ate lunch a couple of times and I felt it was good value for hotel prices - 7.5 USD for burger and chips and 3 USD for a beer (they do add on about 5% tax after). Breakfast was pretty standard with good choice of eggs and the standard anaemic sausages of the area.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was a little quiet when we stayed with few other guests. It therefore didn't have the feel of a lively place to spend a late evening after getting in from town. The bar area is really a few sofas at the end of the restaurant - not really conducive for people getting together to chat, drink etc - but maybe that feel was because of the few people around.
reviews.title: Siem Reap in Early October

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 days. All the staff working there are very friendly and helpful. Free shuttle bus every two hours from the hotel to the town. The room is clean and comfortable. The restaurant is good! I have to say I especially appreciate the hotel even kept our room for us until 3pm the last day and allowed us to use their pool and spa area after that, until we left at 9pm. I am very happy I have chosen this hotel to stay. The fantastic experience!
reviews.title: Truly Five Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 4 days at the Royal Angkor and we had such a wonderful stay it was difficult to leave. The staff is very nice and always have a smile and a positive attitude to work in all of our requests. For an example, They did something that we are very thankful as they  allowed us to check out late to accommodate are late departure time.  The hotel is in very good location, it has beautiful amenities and a nice pool area. The breakfast is delicious with a good selection and quality. They have a spa and we went everyday and the massages are incredible. We really had a wonderful experience in this hotel and definitely  recommend it. It is our first time in Cambodia and we will try to return back in the future and would return to this property. It is a excellent hotel and a wonderful country.
reviews.title: Fantastic amazing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the final leg of our journey through Vietnam and Cambodia. It was without doubt the best and most relaxing hotel of the trip. We stayed for three nights and can honestly say the staff and the resident manager Juliao Antoio Leitao gave us their undivided attention. The hotel was clean,with spacious rooms and a superb lobby bar with a varied food menu and competetively priced food and drink.
reviews.title: fantastic end to our tour

reviews.text: Stayed there for 3 nights with my two teens. The hotel is very clean, confortable, calm and not too far from the main attractions in Siem Reap.
reviews.title: very good hotel

reviews.text: The staff were always kind and we had no problems or any kind of nuisance during our stay.
reviews.title: The staff made it a great experience!

reviews.text: I rate this hotel very highly...i loved its location (people have moaned abouts it's distance from Siem Reap)..i loved the combination of Tuck tucks & daily shuttle bus, especially with bartering with the Tuck Tuck drivers lol) But for me the staff are the jewel of the hotel - 'lovely' really helpful & very friendly....I also loved its decor....The breakfast was fantastic...lots of choice & very relaxing. The pool was fab & so was the spa....
reviews.title: A fabulous hotel & lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot fault this hotel....infact i remember bumping into the general manager..& saying he should be very proud of his hotel.
reviews.title: Great stay, beautiful people..will definitely be back!

reviews.text: I can honestly say that i will be back........
reviews.title: Most personalised hotel stay I've ever had.

reviews.text: The pick up at Siem Reap airport was good. We felt very welcome and the staff are very friendly and informative. We were very pleased with the transfer arrangement. Upon arrival at the hotel, we felt very peaceful & the environment was quiet as there were not much people around. The manager and staff were very welcoming, which made us feel like home. We didn't have to wait long to check in our room which was really great! The room has nice balcoby and facing the huge pool. The hotel provides the transfer from hotel to town (vice versa) which was really great. Hotels also provide the tour and staff are very helpful.
reviews.title: Fabulous Siem Reap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would like to thank all the staff during our stay there. Good job and keep it up! Definitely recommending the hotel and will be back.
reviews.title: Beautiful people and beautiful resort!

description: The Royal Angkor Resort & Spa is a Khmer Classical Designed Resort located in the heart of Siem Reap Angkor. The building is inspired by early 20th Century classical Khmer Architecture; consisting of matured, selected Cambodian species of fauna & flora in a carefully manicured Garden. The Royal Angkor Resort & Spa promotes a unique theme that centres on the culture, heritage, food and the way of life of the Cambodian people. We call it "The Khmer Journey & Experience".
